sections.About: In this course we will study the foundations of differential and integral calculus on smooth manifolds, along with applications of the theory in topology and geometry. One of the main purposes is to acquaint you with differential forms and their great usefulness in many areas of mathematics. The course is one of the first you will take as a graduate student in mathematics.
sections.Entry requirements: General entry requirements and the equivalent of 90 credits in mathematics, including at least 7.5 credits from the second cycle.
sections.Selection: All eligible applicants who have applied before the deadline will be granted a place.
